DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the optimal amount of lidocaine buffering needed to decrease injection pain when administering local anesthesia.
DOC.brief_title: Optimal Lidocaine Buffering to Reduce Injection Pain in Local Anesthesia
DOC.detailed_description: Once the site is chosen, the skin will be anesthetized as usual. This study will utilize a commercially prepared 1% lidocaine solution mixed with standard sodium bicarbonate. A total of 10 mL will be used.
DOC.criteria: adults presenting for routine thyroid biopsy, paracentesis or thoracentesis in interventional radiology Patients requiring sedation Patients with altered mental status Children Patients allergic to lidocaine or sodium bicarbonate
